reasons_to_visit.details: Experience the beginning of Geneva's festive season. The Noël au Jardin market in the Jardin Anglais often opens in mid/late November, offering crafts, food, and Glühwein by the lake.

reasons_to_visit.reason: Low Season Value & Fewer Crowds (Early Nov)
reasons_to_visit.details: Benefit from lower prices for flights and accommodation before the main festive rush. Museums (Art & History, Red Cross) and indoor attractions are generally quiet.
Embrace the cozy ('cocon') season. Ideal weather for exploring Geneva's excellent museums, relaxing in warm cafes (Old Town, Carouge), or indulging in the first fondue of the winter.

reasons_to_visit.reason: Les Automnales Fair & GIFF Film Festival
reasons_to_visit.details: Visit Les Automnales, a large diverse fair at Palexpo (early Nov), or attend screenings at the Geneva International Film Festival (GIFF), showcasing innovative audiovisual works (check dates).
Witness the illumination of Christmas lights along Rue du Marché, Rue du Rhône, and other shopping streets, typically switched on late November, adding festive cheer.

reasons_to_visit.reason: Ideal for Museum Hopping & Watch Boutiques
reasons_to_visit.details: The weather encourages deep dives into Geneva's cultural offerings, from the Ethnography Museum or Patek Philippe Museum to browsing the luxury watch boutiques with fewer onlookers.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: November is typically chilly (avg highs 8-10°C/46-50°F), damp, and frequently overcast or foggy ('stratus'), especially near the lake. The 'bise' wind can add significant chill.
Days become very short (sunset around 4:45-5:15 PM), limiting time for outdoor sightseeing and impacting the overall visibility and mood.
Strolling the lakefront can be cold and windy. Hiking trails on Mont Salève may be muddy or have early snow. Focus shifts almost entirely indoors or to early Christmas markets.
Once Noël au Jardin opens (mid/late Nov), it can become crowded, particularly on weekends and evenings, diminishing the low-season feel.
Essential packing includes thermal layers, an insulated waterproof/windproof coat, hat, gloves, scarf, and waterproof footwear to combat cold, dampness, and wind.

weather.precipitation: High chance of rain, drizzle. Fog ('stratus') is very common, often lingering. Can be windy ('bise'). Overcast days are frequent.
weather.general_tips: Pack for cold, damp, windy conditions. Waterproof layers essential. Focus on indoor activities like museums, festivals (GIFF, Les Automnales).

tourism_level.crowds: Generally low season. Museums quiet. Les Automnales and GIFF attract specific crowds but don't overwhelm the city.
tourism_level.pricing: Good value for flights and accommodation usually available before Christmas market openings.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Quiet late autumn. Focus on indoor warmth and culture. Les Automnales provides a large-scale event buzz at Palexpo; GIFF offers cinematic flair.

events_holidays.name: All Saints' Day (La Toussaint)
events_holidays.description: Public holiday in Geneva canton. Shops, banks, and many businesses are closed. Some museums may open (check hours).
events_holidays.notes: Plan for closures. Restaurants often open. A quiet day in the city.

events_holidays.name: Les Automnales
events_holidays.date: Usually spans a week+ in early/mid November (check exact dates)
events_holidays.description: Large public fair at Palexpo covering diverse themes like home, wellness, local products, animals, often with guest country/region features.
events_holidays.notes: Ticketed event. Accessible by train/bus to Palexpo. Very popular locally.

events_holidays.name: Geneva International Film Festival (GIFF)
events_holidays.date: Usually spans 10 days in early/mid November (check exact dates)
events_holidays.description: Festival dedicated to film, television, and digital arts, with screenings, competitions, and installations across various city venues.
events_holidays.notes: Check official GIFF program for schedule and tickets.

unique_experiences.description: Explore the diverse offerings of this large indoor fair, from local crafts and food to thematic exhibitions.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check the specific themes for the year. Allow several hours. Best accessed by public transport.

unique_experiences.description: Catch an innovative film, TV series screening, or digital art installation as part of the Geneva International Film Festival.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Book tickets online for desired screenings. Check festival program for venues.

unique_experiences.description: Discover fascinating collections from around the world in this modern museum. Excellent indoor activity.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Allow 1.5-2 hours. Check opening times (often closed Mondays).
unique_experiences.estimated_cost: Low-Moderate (entry fee may apply to temp exhibitions)

unique_experiences.activity: Enjoy a Cozy Cafe in Carouge
unique_experiences.description: Escape the November chill with hot chocolate or coffee in one of Carouge's charming, bohemian cafes.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Explore the side streets for hidden gems. Combine with browsing artisan shops (Tues-Sat best).

weather.precipitation: Cold persists. High chance of rain, dampness, fog ('stratus'). First snowflakes possible but rare in the city. Very short daylight.
weather.general_tips: Full winter gear (warm, waterproof, windproof) essential. Dress warmly for outdoor Christmas markets, especially evenings.

tourism_level.crowds: Starts increasing significantly as Noël au Jardin opens and festive lights appear, especially evenings/weekends.
tourism_level.pricing: Accommodation prices might rise, particularly for weekends near market opening.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Shift towards festive season. Noël au Jardin brings Christmas cheer to the lakefront, contrasting with the often grey weather.

events_holidays.name: Opening of Noël au Jardin (Christmas Market)
events_holidays.description: Geneva's main Christmas market opens in the Jardin Anglais, featuring chalet stalls with gifts, food (fondue, raclette), Glühwein, and festive decorations.
events_holidays.notes: Check opening dates/times. Becomes a popular evening destination.

events_holidays.name: Festive Lights Switch-On
events_holidays.description: Illumination of Christmas lights along main shopping streets like Rue du Marché and Rue du Rhône.
events_holidays.notes: Creates a festive atmosphere for evening strolls and shopping.

unique_experiences.activity: Visit Noël au Jardin Christmas Market
unique_experiences.description: Experience Geneva's lakeside Christmas market. Enjoy mulled wine, festive foods, browse craft stalls, and soak up the early festive spirit.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Dress very warmly! Bring cash, though cards often accepted. Can get crowded, especially weekends.

unique_experiences.where: Rue du Marché, Rue du Rhône, surrounding streets
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy the atmosphere of the illuminated shopping streets as the festive season begins.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Best experienced after dark. Combine with window shopping.

unique_experiences.activity: Visit the Musée d'Art et d'Histoire
unique_experiences.description: Explore Geneva's main art and history museum, covering fine arts, applied arts, and archaeology. Ideal for a cold November day.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Allow several hours. Check opening times. Permanent collection free.

unique_experiences.where: Restaurants in Old Town, Pâquis, Carouge, or dedicated fondue chalets (e.g., at Noël au Jardin)
unique_experiences.description: Warm up and indulge in a traditional Swiss cheese fondue as the cold weather sets in.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Reservations recommended for popular restaurants. Try the local 'moitié-moitié' blend.
